translated: Description: The manuscript called Kula-ananda-adi contains short tracts and fragments of early Kaula works. The first is called Kula-ananda and covers the first seven folios. It is attributed to Matsyendranatha. It is important although short. It deals with aspects of Kaula yoga, focused around the piercing (vedha) of spiritual energy through centers of the subtle body following from above and the piercing of Kundalini upwards. The character and form of the exposition, which is in line with other Kaula tracts attributed to Matsyendranatha, supports the view that this is indeed an early Kaula work. The next folios deal with the characteristics of a skull bowl (kapala), which is said to be drawn from the Kula-ananda.
